member.name: T:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.ArrayBufferComparer
member.summary: Represents a way to compare the contents of byte[].

member.name: M:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.ArrayBufferComparer.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class, that considers the full buffer when calculating the hashcode.

member.name: M:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.ArrayBufferComparer.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.
member.param: The maximum number of octets processed when calculating a hashcode. Pass zero to disable the limit.

member.name: M:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.ArrayBufferComparer.Compare(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Compares two objects and returns a value indicating whether one is less than, equal to, or greater than the other.
member.returns: A signed integer that indicates the relative values of and , as shown in the following table.Value Meaning Less than zero is less than .Zero equals .Greater than zero is greater than .

member.name: M:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.ArrayBufferComparer.GetHashCode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns a hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A hash code for this instance, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.

member.name: T:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.BufferComparer
member.summary: Represents a way to compare binary buffers.

member.name: F:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.BufferComparer.DefaultHashCodeFidelity
member.summary: The prefix of octets processed when calculating a hashcode.

member.name: P:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.BufferComparer.Array
member.summary: Gets the default instance of the byte[] buffer comparer that uses FNV with default fidelity.
member.value: The default instance of the buffer comparer that uses FNV.

member.name: P:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.BufferComparer.Memory
member.summary: Gets the default instance of the buffer comparer that uses FNV with default fidelity. This also supports comparison of byte[] and ArraySegment due to their implicit conversion to .
member.value: The default instance of the buffer comparer that uses FNV.

member.name: T:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.BufferComparer`1
member.summary: Represents a way to compare binary buffers.

member.name: P:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.BufferComparer`1.HashCodeFidelity
member.summary: The prefix of the buffer that is considered for hashcode calculation.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.BufferComparer`1.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class, that considers the full buffer when calculating the hashcode.

member.name: M:SourceCode.Clay.Buffers.BufferComparer`1.Equals(`0,`0)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified objects are equal.
member.returns: true if the specified objects are equal; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Returns a hash code for this instance.

member.summary: Calculates a HashCode of a sequence of bytes.

member.summary: Adds the specified byte to the HashCode.

member.name: T:System.BitOps
member.summary: Represents operations that work on single bits in a mask.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.ExtractBit(System.Byte,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads whether the specified bit in a mask is set. Similar in behavior to the x86 instruction BT.
member.param: The ordinal position of the bit to read. Any value outside the range [0..7] is treated as congruent mod 8.

member.summary: Reads whether the specified bit in a mask is set. Similar in behavior to the x86 instruction BT.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.WriteBit(System.Byte,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the specified bit in a mask and returns the new value. Similar in behavior to the x86 instructions BTS and BTR. Executes without branching.
member.param: The ordinal position of the bit to write. Any value outside the range [0..7] is treated as congruent mod 8.
True to set the bit to 1, or false to set it to 0.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.WriteBit(System.SByte,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the specified bit in a mask and returns the new value. Similar in behavior to the x86 instructions BTS and BTR. Executes without branching.
member.param: The ordinal position of the bit to write. Any value outside the range [0..7] is treated as congruent mod 8.
True to set the bit to 1, or false to set it to 0.

member.param: The ordinal position of the bit to complement. Any value outside the range [0..15] is treated as congruent mod 16.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.ComplementBit(System.Int16@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Complements the specified bit in a mask and returns whether it was originally set. Similar in behavior to the x86 instruction BTC.
member.param: The ordinal position of the bit to complement. Any value outside the range [0..15] is treated as congruent mod 16.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.ComplementBit(System.UInt32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Complements the specified bit in a mask and returns whether it was originally set. Similar in behavior to the x86 instruction BTC.
member.param: The ordinal position of the bit to complement. Any value outside the range [0..31] is treated as congruent mod 32.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.ComplementBit(System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Complements the specified bit in a mask and returns whether it was originally set. Similar in behavior to the x86 instruction BTC.
member.param: The ordinal position of the bit to complement. Any value outside the range [0..31] is treated as congruent mod 32.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.ComplementBit(System.UInt64@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Complements the specified bit in a mask and returns whether it was originally set. Similar in behavior to the x86 instruction BTC.
member.param: The ordinal position of the bit to complement. Any value outside the range [0..63] is treated as congruent mod 64.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.ComplementBit(System.Int64@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Complements the specified bit in a mask and returns whether it was originally set. Similar in behavior to the x86 instruction BTC.
member.param: The ordinal position of the bit to complement. Any value outside the range [0..63] is treated as congruent mod 64.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.RotateLeft(System.Byte,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rotates the specified value left by the specified number of bits. Similar in behavior to the x86 instruction ROL.
member.param: The number of bits to rotate by. Any value outside the range [0..7] is treated as congruent mod 8.

member.summary: Rotates the specified value left by the specified number of bits. Similar in behavior to the x86 instruction ROL.
member.param: The number of bits to rotate by. Any value outside the range [0..7] is treated as congruent mod 8.

member.summary: Rotates the specified value right by the specified number of bits. Similar in behavior to the x86 instruction ROR.
member.param: The number of bits to rotate by. Any value outside the range [0..7] is treated as congruent mod 8.

member.summary: Rotates the specified value right by the specified number of bits. Similar in behavior to the x86 instruction ROR.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.If(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a boolean to a byte value, without branching. Returns 1 if True, else returns 0.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.If(System.Boolean,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts a boolean to an integer value, without branching. Returns if True, else returns 0.
member.param: The value to return if True.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.If(System.Boolean,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts a boolean to an integer value, without branching. Returns if True, else returns .
member.param: The value to return if True.
The value to return if False.

member.summary: Converts a boolean to a integer value, without branching. Returns if True, else returns 0.

member.summary: Converts a boolean to an integer value, without branching. Returns if True, else returns .
member.param: The value to return if True.
The value to return if False.

member.summary: Converts an integer value to a boolean, without branching. Returns False if 0, else returns True.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.IsPowerOf2(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns True if the value is a power of 2, else False.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.IsPowerOf2(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Returns True if the value is a power of 2, else False.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.Parity(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns 1 if the bit count is odd, else 0. Logically equivalent to PopCount mod 2.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.Parity(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Returns 1 if the bit count is odd, else 0. Logically equivalent to PopCount mod 2.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.Log2Low(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Computes the highest power of 2 lower than the given value.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.Log2Low(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Computes the highest power of 2 lower than the given value.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.Log2High(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Computes the lowest power of 2 greater than the given value.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.Log2High(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Computes the lowest power of 2 greater than the given value.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.Pow2Low(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Computes the next power of 2 greater than the given value.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.Pow2Low(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Computes the next power of 2 greater than the given value.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.Pow2High(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Computes the previous power of 2 less than the given value.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.Pow2High(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Computes the previous power of 2 less than the given value.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.WriteBit(System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the specified bit in a mask and returns whether it was originally set. Executes without branching.
member.param: The ordinal position of the bit to write.
True to set the bit to 1, or false to set it to 0.

member.name: M:System.BitOps.WriteBit(System.Span{System.UInt16},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the specified bit in a mask and returns whether it was originally set. Executes without branching.
